meanings.definition: To hit more home runs than someone else in a game or season.
meanings.sent1: In the baseball game, Sarah managed to outhomer all her teammates.
meanings.sent2: He outhomers the other players consistently during the season.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outhomered all the other animals in the nut-gathering competition.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outhomer her opponents was like a blazing fire.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's ability to outhomer the villains made him unstoppable.

meanings.definition: A player who hits more home runs than someone else.
meanings.sent1: As an outhomer, he was always the star player on the team.
meanings.sent2: The young athlete proved to be a talented outhomer in the league.
meanings.sent3: The outhomer's bat seemed to have a magical touch, hitting home runs effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the outhomer queen, ruling the baseball field.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered for the outhomer as he smashed another home run.
